meanings.definition: A group of people who settle in a new country or area.
meanings.sent1: The colonies worked together to build new homes in the foreign land.
meanings.sent2: The early American colonies were established by European settlers.
meanings.sent3: The colonies decided to have a friendly competition to see who could build the tallest structure.
meanings.sent4: In the vast desert, the tents formed colonies of shelter against the harsh sun.
meanings.sent5: The colonies flourished as they shared resources and skills to thrive in their new home.

meanings.definition: A group of animals or plants living together.
meanings.sent1: The ant colonies were busy gathering food for the winter.
meanings.sent2: The bee colonies pollinated the flowers in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The colonies of birds chirped happily in the trees, creating a symphony of sounds.
meanings.sent4: The colonies of mushrooms spread across the forest floor like a patchwork quilt.
meanings.sent5: The colonies of algae in the pond provided a vibrant green hue to the water.

meanings.definition: A country or area under the full or partial political control of another country.
meanings.sent1: The colonies gained independence after years of struggle against their rulers.
meanings.sent2: The British colonies in America revolted against the crown for freedom.
meanings.sent3: The colonies decided to throw a surprise party for their ruling nation.
meanings.sent4: The colonies stood united, like a shield against the encroaching influence of the foreign power.
meanings.sent5: The colonies yearned for self-governance, away from the distant control of their overlords.
